If your \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCAN\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Controller Area Network\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e network is long, damaged, or imperfect, you might wind up generating signal errors that cause problems.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eI’m not sure what exact issues you’re seeing, but when we updated our 2024 bot on a full \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCAN\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Controller Area Network\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e network, updates over \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCAN\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Controller Area Network\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e failed, locking the spark to bootloader mode and forcing USB. We weren’t certain if it was our  \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCAN\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Controller Area Network\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e being \u003cem\u003ejust\u003c/em\u003e flaky enough, or if it was some issue with 2025 firmwares having compatibility issues that cause them to not successfully update sparks running 2024
